review_blob:
Nice example of a Braggart style ale.
Malt and apple seem to blend seamlessly with ginger to create a very unique palate and mouth feel. As a cider snob this is as close as Ive come to enjoying a non- cyzer malt / cider ferment.
Much better with age. 6 mos - year seems ideal based on my taste tests.

Delicious IPA with a distinct Belgian aroma and palate. Appealing Belgian sweetness that is quickly balanced with a bright hops flavor sip after sip. Best enjoyed closer to cellar temperature than warm.

Nice color upon pouring but underwhelming nose and palate with weak head retention. Uneven balance of malt sweetness and coffee flavors that come across as a bit jarring. 
Much better coffe porter and stouts available.
A decent example of an American Brown Ale of which there are very few. Low IBU is sufficient to balance the mild malt sweetness. Taste does not linger into the next sip.
